    • Class print.simulation.PrintSimulationGUI extends javax.swing.JFrame implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • percent

          java.text.DecimalFormat percent
          Format for statistical representation of server efficiency.
          See Also:
          PrintSimulationGUI.decimal, DecimalFormat

        • decimal

          java.text.DecimalFormat decimal
          Format to contain statistical data to three decimal places.
          See Also:
          DecimalFormat, PrintSimulationGUI.percent

        • myServers

          Server[] myServers
          Array of servers representing all of the printers in the simulation.
          See Also:
          PrintSimulationGUI.setServers()

        • printQueue

          Queue printQueue
          Queue that all print tasks will pass through and remain in if there are no free servers.
          See Also:
          Queue, PrintSimulationGUI.simOneSecond(int)

        • moreClients

          Client moreClients
          Client reference used for iteration.
          See Also:
          Client

        • meanInterarrivalTime

          int meanInterarrivalTime
          Average time between job arrivals, set by the user.
          See Also:
          PrintSimulationGUI.lockJButtonActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent)

        • currentTime

          int currentTime
          Keeps track of the current time in seconds that the simulation is on.
          See Also:
          PrintSimulationGUI.simToMaxJButtonActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent)

        • statsCount

          int statsCount
          Amount of times the statistics button has been pressed. Allows for toggling of the statistics screen.
          See Also:
          PrintSimulationGUI.statsJButtonActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent), PrintSimulationGUI.showStats()

        • intervalActive

          boolean intervalActive
          Boolean value representing whether or not there is a current interval active, meaning a job is waiting to arrive.
          See Also:
          PrintSimulationGUI.createNewInterval(int), PrintSimulationGUI.handleInterval(int)

        • jobCreationTime

          int jobCreationTime
          The time in seconds that the new Job will enter the system.
          See Also:
          PrintSimulationGUI.createNewInterval(int), PrintSimulationGUI.handleInterval(int), PrintSimulationGUI.currentTime

        • maxTime

          int maxTime
          The maximum time in seconds the simulation will be allowed to run, set by the user.
          See Also:
          PrintSimulationGUI.lockJButtonActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent), PrintSimulationGUI.simToMaxJButtonActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent)

        • caret

          javax.swing.text.DefaultCaret caret
          Handles the scrolling of the output text area. Used so that autoscrolling does not force the scroll to the bottom of the data.

        • icon

          javax.swing.ImageIcon icon
          Icon to be used on creation of all JOptipnPane and JFrame screens and popups.
          See Also:
          JOptionPane

        • stats

          PrintStats stats
          Class reference used for easy statistical operations for common occurrences.
          See Also:
          PrintStats

        • averageQueueSize

          double averageQueueSize
          Statistical variable used to compute the average queue size.
          See Also:
          PrintSimulationGUI.queueSize

        • averageNumJobsInSystem

          double averageNumJobsInSystem
          Statistical variable used to compute the average number of jobs that are in the entire system, queue or service, at once.
          See Also:
          PrintSimulationGUI.simOneSecond(int)
